ranked_diseases.explanation: The patient's presentation of self-healing squamous epithelioma is characteristic of the condition known as Multiple Self-Healing Squamous Epithelioma. Similar reference cases with matching phenotypes (though those include more features) were diagnosed with this condition.

Basal Cell Nevus Syndrome can manifest with self-healing squamous epithelioma as part of its spectrum. While other characteristic features of this syndrome are absent, it's a possible match based on the single feature presented.

Keratoacanthoma is a skin lesion that can exhibit spontaneous regression, a feature similar to self-healing squamous epithelioma. Though often not genetic, it is included for the 'self-healing' aspect.
